alert.note: Alert for Bear River Range; Big Hole Mountains; Caribou Range (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 06 at 12:30PM MST until January 07 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches for lower elevations with 3 to 10 inches for passes and ridge tops each day (this afternoon into early evening and Friday). So a total of 2 to 8 inches for lower elevations and 6 to 20 inches for passes and ridge tops). Winds gusting around 30 to 35 mph with localized gusts around 40 mph. * WHERE...Emigration Summit, Wayan, Pine Creek Pass, and Victor. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MST Friday. Current wave of moisture will continue until early evening. There will be a pause and the next wave of moistures starts late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commutes. Blowing and drifting of snow is likely especially this afternoon into early evening and Friday afternoon into early Saturday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Overnight expect wet roads to freeze, especially above 5500 feet.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Bear River Range; Big Hole Mountains; Caribou Range
